comment.body:
@leftside: The bible was written 100 - 200 years after Jesus' death. All stories are from hearsay and there are only tales in a big book.
If you look at the date of many christian celebrating days, you will find out that the former pagans had a celebration day at that time. The church put a celebration day exactly on this time to force the people into their faith (and prohibited the celebration of the pagan day).
Formerly the people celebrated the coming back of the sun at December 25th. The roots are in Egypt. The Christmas tree is a pagan sign as well and was only "occupied" from the church.
There is no chapter in the bible about Christmas. It is all a lie.
I do nit believe in any religion or any god.

@leftside: I have nothing created in my mind. 
What you call "Many parts of the bible" is the Old Testament. Look at Wikipedia:
"The Christian Old Testament overlaps with the Hebrew Bible and the Greek Septuagint; the Hebrew Bible is known in Judaism as the Tanakh. "
The Christians just took over the parts from the Tanakh.
"Even the Gospels", as you wrote, is the whole New Testament. The Gospels are only 1 of 4 genres. The New Testament is written some decades after Jesus's death. True. The whole content is transported from mouth to mouth. If you do this about some generations, how much from the original "story" will be in the final and written version? 
I believe in science and what I wrote was not from my mind, it all is well researched and you can proof it. I know that Wikipedia is not the best way to proof something, but in this case it is true. Sometimes hard to believe for believers.

Networks as well as currencies.
@ulrichard: Ich bin gespannt, wo die Reise hingeht. Ein guter Coin ist jedenfalls notwendig. Bargeld wird immer unattraktiver und Kartenzahlung is ja alles andere als "privat".
